result.execSummary:
The defendant Beau O Britt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for early discharge if recommended by Agent.
*Per Court Order 10/05/22: Probation is extended for 12 months or until completion of MRT and Restorative Justice.
Concurrent with: 16CF147 - Count 1*

miscConds.notes: $672.72 Restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $67.27, for a total of $739.99, to be paid to the Department of Corrections while on supervision under a payment plan established with the supervising agent.  Any bail amount posted shall be applied with any remaining amount to be returned to poster.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.

$268.00 court costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Any bail amount posted shall be applied with any remaining amount to be returned to poster.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Absolute Sobriety.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to be in/on any premises that sell alcohol as their primary business, includes bars, taverns and liquor stores.
 Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances without a prescription and if prescribed by a physician, only in the amounts prescribed.
No contact with Curtis or Joyce Lundgren.

Must cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or correctional program as directed by the Department of Corrections and complete any recommended treatment successfully.  
Must participate in Restorative Justice.
Must complete MRT.  
Must follow all other rules and regulations required by the supervising agent.
Must pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. 
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing on January 2, 2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing on January 2, 2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
No contact with Ms. Romaro. Absolute Sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 45 days up front. Not subject to good time. Subject to Huber. Balance of jail time is banked for use by Probation Agent if necessary.
Concurrent with: 16CF147
